Package Engine.Physics

Class Movement

java.lang.Object
Engine.Physics.Physics
Engine.Physics.Movement
Direct Known Subclasses:
CharacterPhysics, EntityPhysics
public class Movement extends Physics
This class defines methods that help to organise how objects move in the physics simulation.
Author:
Joshua Dowlman

  • Constructor Details

    • Movement

      public Movement()
      A blank constructor

    • Movement

      public Movement(double xVelocity, double yVelocity, double xAcceleration, double yAcceleration, double mass)
      A constructor that sets the xVelocity, yVelocity, xAcceleration, yAcceleration and mass
      Parameters:
      xVelocity - A double that represents the horizontal velocity
      yVelocity - A double that represents the vertical velocity
      xAcceleration - A double that represents the horizontal acceleration
      yAcceleration - A double that represents the vertical acceleration
      mass - A double the represents the mass

    • setHitBoxRectangle

    • setHitBoxTriangle

      public void setHitBoxTriangle(ArrayList<Double> line1, ArrayList<Double> line2, ArrayList<Double> line3)
      Sets the hitbox type to a triangle and takes in additional parameters required to compute the hitbox
      Parameters:
      line1 - An arraylist of double where the first element is y, the second is m (the gradient) and the third is x
      line2 - An arraylist of double where the first element is y, the second is m (the gradient) and the third is x
      line3 - An arraylist of double where the first element is y, the second is m (the gradient) and the third is x

      Shape representing the hitbox shape

    • Collision

      public void Collision(ArrayList<Movement> objectsCollidedWith)
      Called when a collision occurs and can be overridden to allow for different behaviour
      Parameters:
      objectsCollidedWith - An arraylist with every object that it has collided with
